fields.description:
Scan of ClearCase fails with this error:
Repository index failed due to error - class com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: com.atlassian.fisheye.plugins.scm.utils.process.ProcessException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/atlassian/fisheye2.1/var/tmp/04037d51.c8da41e2.8a00.07d3be2b704b.tmp (No such file or directory)

I have tried to delete the index and rebuild and the same error is reproduced.
fields.summary: ClearCase scan issue

fields.description:
You can add constraints to your view using the filter which will be respected by the watch. 

Unfortunately, there seems to be a bug in the way this is being applied at the moment. The constraint doesn't exist at the user profile watches. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to 'Source' tab and click on a repository
# Select a directory and click on 'Activity' tab
# Click on 'Filter' check box an set the constraint (e.g committer see [filter.png|^filter.png]) 
# Click "Apply Constraints" button 
# Select "watch" at the "Tools" drop down
# Check the watches via the user profile (see [watches.png|^watches.png])
fields.summary: Watches don't respect filter contraints

fields.description:
We see a reasonable amount of support cases where the customer integrates with LDAP, and then find themselves in a situation where they have duplicate users differing only in the case. 

* http://forums.atlassian.com/message.jspa?messageID=257293042

Its not a trivial task to create such a script and I don't think its something we should really be advertising through support. 

It would be better if we forced the lower case option by default preventing this situation, then someone would have to explicitly turn on mixed case usernames.
fields.summary: Force usernames to be lowercase by default.

fields.description:
FishEye correctly decodes URL-escaped characters in file names. It does not correctly decode some URL-escaped characters in directory names, in all areas of the display, but leaves them as %20 or %25 ("this is a directory" appears as "this%20is%20a%20directory"; "abc%def%ghi" appears as "abc%25def%25ghi").

There is no ambiguity, since the "%" character itself is encoded as "%25".

You need to make sure all the URL-escaped characters are decoded properly. Sometimes they are and sometimes they are not. This is very strange. Here are the areas I have found so far that are not unescaping them:

1) the "breadcrumb trail" in the upper left showing the directory hierarchy
2) the icon + directory name above the Files/Activity/Users/Reports/Query tabs

It looks like it decodes correctly if I get to the directory by navigating to it via the icons within the Files tab (in which case I get the display seen in fisheye003.png). But if I get to a directory with spaces or %'s in the name, but clicking on that directory via the tree on the left-hand side of the pane, the name is not decoded properly, and subdirectories of that tree do not appear at all (fisheye004.png) so it looks like there are missing files.
fields.summary: %20 in directory names not decoded as a space, %25 in directory names not decoded as %, directory tree not navigated properly

fields.description:
Our repositories include quite a few files that are not source code (PDF files, circuit schematics, etc.)

If I use the "exclude" feature of the per-repository configuration in FishEye, the files excluded do not show up at all. This is bad, because someone using FishEye to browse the repository will have no idea they are not there.

If I do not use the "exclude" feature, the index caches are HUGE. I have a relatively new repository that is, at present, 55MB in size on the server disk (just the Subversion directory), and most of that space is from binary files (PDFs + schematic files). With most binary files excluded, the FishEye cache is 1.6MB. Without any exclude entries, the FishEye cache is 58MB which is slightly larger than the repository itself. This is bad since it is needlessly wasted space for files that have no benefit from full-text indexing, and I expect the situation to get worse as my repository becomes larger (I'm only at revision 38 right now).

Right now it's a lose-lose situation. Please fix and make it possible to view the basic properties of a file in Fisheye + see its history, while excluding it from full-text indexing, which is useless on binary files and on files that are not meant to be human-editable or have meaningful diffs.
fields.summary: can't exclude files/dirs from indexing, but include them for display + revision graphing/tracking

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Browse to _Source -> <repo> -> <click on the folder name>_
2. Note that the URL on the browser did not synchronize with the folder selected but the URL of the 'Watch' link does show it correctly ([screenshot-1|^screenshot-1.JPG])
3. Click on the 'Watch' link does not take any effect ([screenshot-1_result|^screenshot-1_result.JPG]) 
4. Try to select one of the file in the folder and watch it. ([screenshot-2|^screenshot-2.JPG])
5. The file has been added successfully into the watches list ([screenshot-2_result|^screenshot-2_result.JPG])
6. Try to select the folder again. This time the URL on the browser does show it correctly ([screenshot-3|^screenshot-3.JPG])
7. Watch the folder take the effect now ([screenshot-3_result|^screenshot-3_result.JPG])
fields.summary: The folder link not consistent in the browser making the Watch feature takes no effect

fields.description:
Allow to set a watches in bulk; on all/several files of a search result. 

Currently the user would have to open each file in detail separately and set the watch manually. 
Having more bulk-operations such as this one would increase usability. 

In order to prevent problems with doubles/deleted files in a search result, this functionality could be limited to searches with the "Search HEAD only" applied.
fields.summary: set watch on multiple files of a search result

fields.description:
Yeah, not a problem at all. Usually I'd file a Jira or something (I've
got a long history with the Atlassian public development model), but
didn't really have time at the moment.

Not a worry if they want to follow up, or once things quiet down here
a little getting us to try an experiment.

Kirk

fields.description:
Fisheye doesn't seem to recognize when a file has been renamed in svn. I renamed a file "tada1.png" to "screenshot1.png". It recognizes that tada1.png has been deleted and screenshot1.png has been added, but in the folder structure on the left, and in the changelist summary, it does not recognize this as a rename.

Yet on the revisions page (see fisheye02.png screenshot) it recognizes the file has been moved.
fields.summary: fisheye doesn't recognize svn renaming

fields.description:
We really, really need a way to create a script for user handling and thus would like some new functionality in FishEye's API:
*) Create a new user
*) Assign membership to a group for a user
*) Question FishEye for certain group membership for a user (for homemade auth in createUser script)

I hope this is a really easy thing for you guys to do and keep my fingers crossed it will happen soon.

Kind regards,
Erika
fields.summary: User admin in FishEye API

fields.description:
In FishEye 1.6, if you typed a filename (ie MyFile.java) into the quicksearch box, if a file by that matched in your repository you jumped right to the history of that file.  In 2.0.6, if you type a filename into the quicksearch box, it searches all history of comments & content & whatnot for that string and returns everything.  Using quicksearch to zoom into a file is now completely unusable.  In order to search for a file you have to:

1) Click Source
2) Click the repository name
3) Click the Query tab
4) Type the name in the "file name" box & hit enter.

And even then it doesn't jump right to the file -- it lists each and every revision of the file and makes you choose one.  And clicking on the file jumps to the file's page, which lists all the revisions yet again.

Please make searching for files easier.
fields.summary: Searching for files is much harder in 2.0

fields.description: It would be amazing if I could go to my normal FE/CRU instance and see data from all the random repositories I follow.  This would work well with the FE-2262 feature, so I could have a "Remote" dashboard and tell it to stream data from, say, http://fisheye6.atlassian.com/changelog/httpcomponents & http://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/google-guice (fisheye2 is still running the old version!), and other things (some not hosted by atlassian).
fields.summary: Allow remote instances to feed into activity

fields.description:
It would be really nice to be able to create multiple dashboards that each pull from a different set of repositories/projects, and you can flip between them just by clicking on them.  Also, it would be nice to be able to share these dashboards with other.

My use-case is that I have my main dashboard of my day-to-day stuff, and various other things that I like to check up on.  It'd much less a PITA if all I had to do was click the right dashboard which coalesced the projects, instead of clicking on each source/project combo and viewing them individually (if they weren't in my main dashboard).
fields.summary: Allow multiple [named?] dashboards, and sharing

fields.description:
See https://www.limewire.org/fisheye/browse . We must have had a day about 6 months ago when someone committed a LOT of stuff.  The result is the chart showing commit history has a huge bar on that day, but every other day's changes are shrunk to a tiny size.  Same thing with https://www.limewire.org/fisheye/users -- from looking at that, it's pretty clear Peter was the one who did the commit, because his chart has the same huge spike (and everything else shrunk).

It would be nice if the charts were scaled in a way that the outliers didn't cause the rest of the data to be meaningless.
fields.summary: Outliers in data make charts less than useful
FishEye Charting portlet: wrong URL to generated chart

fields.description: FishEye doesn't appear to have any support for localization at the moment, it would be nice for this support to be included in order to be consistent with the i18n support in the other Atlassian applications

fields.description:
If you try to view a "large" (1MB+) file in the annotated view (or in reviews), it hammers the web browser and causes a huge (temporary) increase in CPU+RAM usage and hangs the browser. 

The plain text view works fine, with a small stall whilst the browser downloads it so we are doing something poorly on the client side.

fields.description:
When trying to startup fisheye 2.1 it crashes with an out of memory error unless you adjust the max heap size in FISHEYE_OPTS:

{noformat}java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:106)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:39)
Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
        at java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream.write(ByteArrayOutputStream.java:95)
        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.IOUtils.copyLarge(IOUtils.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.IOUtils.copy(IOUtils.java:37)
        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.IOUtils.toByteArray(IOUtils.java:31)

        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.ModzDetector.checkResource(ModzDetector.java:153)
        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.ModzDetector.checkResource(ModzDetector.java:201)
        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.ModzDetector.checkRegistry(ModzDetector.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.ModzDetector.getModifiedFiles(ModzDetector.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.modzdetector.ModzDetector.getModifiedFiles(ModzDetector.java:36)

Related issue is [MODZ-2|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/MODZ-2] which was fixed in Modz Detector 0.8 so we should upgrade from 0.6.

fields.description:
Currently the includes/excludes rules check to see if a VOB is equal to, contains or matches an includes rule.  This should be updated so that users can explicitly specify the exact VOB name to include/exclude.

In addition, the rules should filter down to allow subdirectories to be included/excluded
fields.summary: Enable users to specify if they want the includes/excludes rule to be exact matches

fields.description:
> > James Roper wrote:
> >> I believe I've found the cause of the problems.  I'm not 100% certain,
> >> but talking with Don Brown, he agrees with me somewhat.  For the
> >> technically minded:
> >>
> >> Crucible has a hibernate interceptor that updates some RPC timestamp
> >> everytime an update is done to the database.  This interceptor is a
> >> static inner class.  It is instantiated and run, but the outer class
> >> isn't loaded and initialised until the inner class calls update() on
> >> the outer class, this method is called whenever write operations are
> >> called.  It's on this method that NoClassDefFound errors are being
> >> thrown, which indicates the outer class is failing to load.  To load
> >> the outerclass, several JAX-RS classes need to be loaded, and one is
> >> even instantiated.  JAX-RS uses the context classloader for a lot of
> >> things.  It's our guess therefore that if this method is called during
> >> the execution of a plugins 2 plugin (eg streams), the context
> >> classloader is not what JAX-RS is expecting, so it throws a
> >> NoClassDefFoundError, which causes the outer class to fail to load.
> >> This unexpected error throws hibernate into a bad state, and all
> >> subsequent calls to hibernate fail.  The exact failure is unknown,
> >> because on each request, the first hibernate call is done by the
> >> crucible filter, which is trying to get the current user, which then
> >> in a finally block attempts to pop the current user, even though it
> >> failed to push it, and so an IllegalStateException is thrown, losing
> >> the hibernate error.
> >>
> >> Restarting FishEye helps solve this issue, as long as the first
> >> request made to it that uses the database *isn't* one handled by a
> >> plugins to plugin (eg streams).
> >>
> >> The workaround for this problem is to ensure that the outer class
> >> initialised when FishEye starts up, hopefully using a simple HTTP
> >> request.  I'll talk to Erik van Zijst about this.
> >>
> >> Regards,
> >>
> >> James
fields.summary: NoClassDefFound error on Studio

fields.description:
There is a memory leak in Lucene's IndexWriter that manifests when a the IndexWriter is used to index a large number of Documents over its lifetime.

This can cause FishEye to fail with an OutOfMemoryError after running for some time, particularly during a large initial index or re-index operation.
fields.summary: Memory leak in IndexWriter will eventually cause OOME

fields.description: Currently, the includes/excludes rules for the UCM ClearCase support is only applying to UCM projects.  This needs to be updated to also handle UCM VOBs, so that users with large ClearCase repositories can exclude VOBs easily.
fields.summary: The Includes/Excludes rules should handle UCM VOBs as well as UCM projects

fields.description: Currently, the clearcase code is throwing an exception if it encounters UCM VOBS which don't contain Projects.  The code should cater for this situation by logging the information and continue with the index.
fields.summary: Ensure that repository scanning logic handles UCM Vobs which have no projects

fields.description:
When the activity stream renders links it uses ServletUtils.getBaseUrl(request) which uses req.getServerName(), rather than using the relative url to generate the link. If you have proxied fisheye with another webserver such as apache its possible the links generated will be wrong. Particularly if you haven't correctly configured the [fisheye webserver settings|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+the+FishEye+Web+Server]. {code:xml}

commented on CR-4

{code} If we used relative URLs this problem would be avoided.
fields.summary: Activity Stream uses absolute URLs

fields.description:
To make reviews less painful, it would be helpful to allow related changesets to be grouped into one review.
Since related changesets are likely to include the same file in one or more changesets, it is quite annoying that Fish Eye does not allow mutiple changesets to be included when the same file is included in more than one changeset.
fields.summary: Not able to include multiple changesets in one review when the same file appears in more than one of the included changesets

fields.description:
When creating a new review, all recent changesets are presented even when they have already been included in earlier reviews.
This means I have to either keep track manually which changesets I have already sent out for review, or I have to browse through past open and closed revires to figure out which changesets are already covered by reviews.
This is quite an annoying deficiency making the review process not quite as "painless" as advertized.
fields.summary: Show only the changesets that are not yet included in my other reviews when creating a new review

fields.description: This issue has been reported both in Studio (https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-1876) and on the forums (http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=37033)

fields.description:
Improve the initial setup experience as follows:

1. tidy up the UI
2. Handle invalid licenses more gracefully (i.e. detect adding FE license in CRU license field, etc)
fields.summary: Improve initial setup experience

fields.description:
Description from customer:

{quote}
Referring to FSH-1710

Version:2.0.2 Build:build-412 2009-07-24

Hi, I just had the same problem described in FSH-1710 on a newer version of FishEye. I am currently running in parallel to our production installation an evaluation license to index a large repository and to move the resource intensive indexing to a non production server. The problem occurs on our evaluation licensed server but is affecting the production environment since we use a shared account for different systems to access SVN.

I was adding a new repository and had enable immediately checked. I entered the password with a typo (letter O confused with number 0). The problem is, that Fisheye seems to try to connect several times. Our authentication server locks the account after three failed log on attempts. Stopping the misconfigured repository did not help. Our Network operations group reported that the account was locked immediately again after unlocking it. I had to stop and start Fisheye to solve this issue.

For me I need to remember not to enable the repository immediately and first test the connection. It would be great if the initial screen would have a "test connection" function as well which is only available after the repository was added which is then too late if something goes wrong with the configuration.

Andreas
{quote}
fields.summary: Wrong SVN user password locks account on Active Directory server in Windows

fields.description: Using FishEye/Crucible 2.0.1 I click on the 'Source' tab and then the 'Repositories' tab when I list all the repositories, I get a nice concise list of all my repositories, their current state, commit history (graph), Latest Activity, LOC, commits, & reviews.  I would like to know if there is a way (aka confluence macro) to display this on a confluence page, or a way to create a PDF from this page?
fields.summary: Export Repositories tab to PDF or macro for confluence

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Commit a test.sql file into the repository (the source of the file can be shown up in FishEye)
2. Add the properties svn:mime-type (e.g. svn:mime-type = image/gif) to that file and commit it(now the content of the file cannot be displayed as it is a binary file)
3. Remove the properties and commit it again (the content of the file failed to show up as it is still displayed as binary file even though a full re-index of the repository is being executed)

Please see the screenshots for a clearer picture: [Original|^original.JPG], [PropertiesSet|^PropertiesSet.JPG], [Source_PropertiesSet|^Source_PropertiesSet.JPG], [PropertiesRemoved|^PropertiesRemoved.JPG], [Source_PropertiesRemoved|^Source_PropertiesRemoved.JPG]
fields.summary: Fisheye treats files as binary if they used to have a svn:mime-type property, even after the property has been removed

fields.description:
Description from the customer:

We are evaluating JIRA+Fisheye connected to our Perforce repository. The repository scan hangs on the first changeset and it seems like Fisheye is excecuting a bad perforce command:
"p4 -p doris:1666 -u perforce -x - print"
Note the empty '-' before 'print' at the end.
This command also hangs if issued at the command line. If I turn off diff info processing the repository scan works fine.

Created from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-2516
fields.summary: Perforce repository scan hangs when processing diff info

fields.description:
OpenGrok allows Source Code Searching and uses the Lucine engine like other Atlassian products.

Adding Opengrok would help improve search results.
fields.summary: Integrate Opengrok too Fisheye Searches

fields.description:
Our SVN installation is integrated with Active Directory, so that our SVN usernames are of the form "DOMAIN\UserA". FishEye seems to get confused with the case of the users' credentials. For instance, the Repository Activity page displays the user as "DOMAIN\UserA", with a matching link (http://myfisheye/fisheye/committer/asrs-products/DOMAIN%5CUserA). Clicking this link results in a 404 error. However, if I manually change the case of the link to all lower (http://myfisheye/fisheye/committer/asrs-products/domain%5Cusera), then the page is loaded correctly.

Either the mixed-case links should work as expected, or the user information should be lower case throughout the application (such as they are in the Committer Mapping setup).
fields.summary: Committer information seems to be case-sensitive, but case is not consistent throughout app

fields.description:
Search for "file:CX", e.g. [https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/qsearch?q=file%3ACX]. 

Get the results like in the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Camel Case Searches return matches for lower case names

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20090928-c3xaiqnb64nyirffa8q3dt1t7m.png!
fields.summary: joe doe avatar problems

fields.description:
In http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+the+Dashboard we don't describe to new users that "All Activity" only shows your activity until you start starring repos/directories or users. 

So a new user will wonder why only their activity is displayed when logged in, but anonymous users see all activity on the dashboard. 


see [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-2515]
fields.summary: Document on how to use the dashboard.

fields.description:
Refer to the issue [FSH-2484|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-2484]. If I have 3 files (with the same filename) located under different directories. The quick search doesn't return the correct results. (See the [attached screen shot|^search.png])
 
Steps to reproduce
# Load the attached svndump to your repo
For example:
{noformat}
svnadmin load REPOS_PATH < svndump
{noformat}
# Use In-built Symbolic Rules 
# Once the repository has finished indexing, do a quick search for the file 'AbstractSecurity.java'
# Note that it doesn't return the 'AbstractSecurity.java' under the trunk directory
fields.summary: QuickNav doesn't return the correct results

fields.description:
Currently the generated html, nor the wadl copy the @deprecated tag from the javadoc.
Mostly a jersey-wadl-doclet issue though.
fields.summary: Add deprecation info to WADL and HTML

fields.description: The {{compareSecondarySort}} method on ChangeSet is expected to be able to compare with ChangeSets of a different concrete class to the receiver
fields.summary: RevidChangeSet casts parameter to compareSecondarySort, causes ClassCastException when sorting activity from different types of repo

fields.description:
I would like to see an option that would let me stop Fisheye emailing me on a watched folder in Perforce if it was me that did the checkin. 

The reasoning is quite simple - the "Watch" feature informs me of changes other people have made to bots of code I am interested in. It seems a bit odd that it also informs me of changes I made myself, and so the email just ends up effectively as spam.

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-2454 for original query.
fields.summary: Option to prevent Fishey emailing me about my own checkins on a watched folder

fields.description:
We recently switched from Fisheye 1.6 to 2.0 and I noticed that several scripts using the Fisheye API & EyeQl don't work as before.

In 2.0.4, when I execute a query with EyeQl, it only returns one record per changeset, no matter what the 'group by' or 'return' clause is.
It used to be possible in 1.6 to get the complete list of files that were changed, not simply the list of changesets.

e.g. when viewing ticket FG-969 in Jira, I see the following in the fisheye tab:

  4120  by  Walter Brebels  (9 files)   - FG-969	21/Sep/09 03:05 PM (19 hours, 19 minutes ago)
branches/wbrebels-dev/spumo/sip_session.c 4120 history download (+29 -3) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/dcamsip/business_logic.c 4120 history download (+38 -12) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/wsui/wsui.c 4120 history download (+23 -0) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/dcamsip/dcamsip.c 4120 history download (+31 -2) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/dcamsip/sdl_stuff.c 4120 history download (+7 -5) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/dcamsip/business_logic.h 4120 history download (+3 -0) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/libsip/sipphone.h 4120 history download (+2 -0) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/dcamsip/dcamsip.h 4120 history download (+19 -0) diffs
branches/wbrebels-dev/dcamsip/main.c 4120 history download (+11 -1) diffs

4121 by  Michael Forton (11 files) - FG-969: CARE 1.0: Video window (and PiP) on fiftscreen should be scaled up to "as large as possible	21/Sep/09 03:43 PM (18 hours, 41 minutes ago)
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/images/normalscreen_icon_prs.png 4121 history download new
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/html/phone.htm 4121 history download (+7 -19) diffs
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/javascript/widgets.js 4121 history download (+10 -2) diffs
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/javascript/phone.js 4121 history download (+62 -15) diffs
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/images/fullscreen_icon.png 4121 history download new
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/javascript/5g_utils.js 4121 history download (+4 -4) diffs
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/images/fullscreen_icon_prs.png 4121 history download new
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/version 4121 history download (+1 -1) diffs
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthsentry/src/stylesheet/main.css 4121 history download (+3 -3) diffs
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/stylesheet/videomessage.css 4121 history download (+46 -0) diffs
branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/images/normalscreen_icon.png 4121 history download new 

But when querying through the API, or in the EyQL window using the following query:
select revisions where comment matches FG-969 return path,revision as rev,comment
i only get 2 records, instead of the 20 expected:
1 	branches/wbrebels-dev/dcamsip/main.c	4120 	FG-969
2 	branches/mforton-UI-R1.7.6/ui/fifthscreen/src/images/normalscreen_icon.png	4121 	FG-969: CARE 1.0: Video window (and PiP) on fiftscreen should be scaled up to "as large as possible 

I suppose this is a bug in EyeQL.
fields.summary: EyeQL only returns one file per changeset

fields.description:
See the screenshot (reported by Seb).

I couldn't quite reproduce this, so it may affect 2.0.5 as well.

In fact, when I tried to reproduce, it sometimes wouldn't scroll the file tree at all.
fields.summary: Deeplinking to a file annotation positions the file tree weirdly

fields.description: The review history log upgrade task requires the FE db to be restored and available by the time the crucible db is restored, so we must freeze the order in which items are backed up and restored.
fields.summary: Restore items in fixed order

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
1. Go to https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye/browse/atlassian/performance/fisheye/performance-metrics/src/test/java/com/atlassian/fisheye/performance/TestJmeterPerformanceScriptsAreWorking.java?r1=97946&r2=98971&u=3
2. Click on the star

*Expected*
- The star turns yellow (without a page-pop)
- The item appears in your star menu at the top
- When you refresh the page the star is still yellow

*Actual*
- The star turns yellow (without a page-pop)
fields.summary: Starring a diff appears to work but actually fails
The wadl stylesheet ignores matrix params

fields.description:
Developer documentation for FE and CRU on DAC has been merged into a single "fisheye-crucible" directory, so the current {{http://docs.atlassian.com/crucible/1.6.3/}} on the CAC Development Hub will no longer be valid as of 2.1, but instead need to point to {{http://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/2.1}}

Also see: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2469#c21914
fields.summary: Update links to docs.atlassian.com

fields.description:
I'm just testing the FishEye 2.0.4 against one local subversion server via the http protocol

It works well with the embedded SVN client, but when I switch to native subversion client the following errors appear:

ERROR [InitialPinger1] fisheye.app RepositoryScanner-slurp - Problem processing revisions from repo http://svn.local.net/svn/work/ due to class com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException - org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: RA layer request failed
svn: REPORT of '/svn/work/!svn/bc/1025': 200 OK (http://svn.local.net)

com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: RA layer request failed
svn: REPORT of '/svn/work/!svn/bc/1025': 200 OK (http://svn.local.net)

        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.logMessages(SvnThrottledClient.java:130)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.getRevList(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:140)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.updateRevList(RepositoryScanner.java:532)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.processRevisions(RepositoryScanner.java:379)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurpRepository(RepositoryScanner.java:266)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurp(RepositoryScanner.java:186)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.ping(RepositoryScanner.java:119)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(SvnRepositoryEngine.java:68)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.OneOffPingRequest.doRequest(OneOffPingRequest.java:30)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.process(PingRequest.java:90)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processPingRequests(RepositoryHandle.java:120)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.queuePingRequest(RepositoryHandle.java:110)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.run(PingRequest.java:57)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
Caused by: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: RA layer request failed
svn: REPORT of '/svn/work/!svn/bc/1025': 200 OK (http://svn.local.net)

        at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.logMessages(Native Method)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.logMessages(SvnThrottledClient.java:128)
        ... 15 more

Running on Ubuntu 9.04 Linux/x86 with subversion and libsvn-java version 1.5.4dfsg1-1ubuntu2.1 packages installed
Setup applied to switch to native client:
Native lib: /usr/lib/jni/libsvnjavahl-1.so
Jar lib: /usr/share/java/svn-javahl.jar
fields.summary: FishEye fails to scan SVN repository with native client 1.5.4

fields.description:
Currently the LoC Stats for the users page only calculates LoC for commits against trunk. 

This is confusing to users who can see commits being made to branches, but their LoC stats not updating (since no where we explain that only the trunk code is considered for LoC.
fields.summary: Document how LOC stats are calculated on the users page

fields.description:
When you're looking at users in a branch, it should show the loc for that branch, but it doesn't: 

[https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/users/FE/branches/ccdev]

This is because only trunk code is considered for LoC
fields.summary: Currently in the Users view, only Trunk code is considered for LOC. When constraining to branch we should show LOC for branch
Add FishEye services

fields.description:
We are having issue browsing the  the jira projects right after CSV import.  Browsing issues takes almost minute and half to come up. where as once the project is mapped to dummy repo everything browsing speed dramatically increases.

Is this realted to fisheye or some other special setting that needs to be in place for imported projects ?
fields.summary: Having problem Browsing the project that is not mapped to subversion repostiory
Improve stylesheet layout

fields.description: Deleting a user does not delete their associated mappings
fields.summary: Deleting a user does not delete their mappings

fields.description:
FishEye/Crucible was added as of AMPS beta5 (which is being released later today, September 15th)

We need to update the CAC AMPS / plugin development to flaunt it.
fields.summary: Add FishEye/Crucible to AMPS documentation

fields.description:
Refer to [FSH-2424|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-2424].
Currently, you can set a charset to a repository, however, there isn't any options to set it globally. It would be good if an administrator can set a default charset globally e.g an extra option at the "Repository Defaults".
fields.summary: Allow default charset to be set globally
Support more than one example request/response

fields.description:
Using the {{@response.representation.200.example}} doctag seems to only generate XML examples.

We'd probably need to change the doclet, wadl generator, and stylesheets.
fields.summary: Make the doclet/wadl generator output example JSON
